symbols.name: sap.zen.commons
symbols.description: Design Studio Commons Library. Intended only to be used within S/4 HANA Fiori applications.

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.HAlign
symbols.description: Horizontal alignment, e.g. of a layout cell's content within the cell's borders. Note that some values depend on the current locale's writing direction while others do not.

deprecated.text: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

properties.name: Begin
properties.description: Aligned towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: Horizontally centered.

properties.name: End
properties.description: Aligned towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

properties.name: Left
properties.description: Left aligned, regardless of the current locale's writing direction.

properties.name: Right
properties.description: Right aligned, regardless of the current locale's writing direction.

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout
symbols.description: The Absolute Layout positions its child controls absolutely

properties.name: width
properties.description: The overall width of the control. When not set, 100% is automatically set.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The overall height of the control. When not set, 100% is automatically set.

properties.name: verticalScrolling
properties.description: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.

properties.name: horizontalScrolling
properties.description: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.

aggregations.name: positions
aggregations.description: Positioned child controls within the layout

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new layout/AbsoluteLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: addContent

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted.

parameters.name: oPos
parameters.description: JSON-like object which defines the position of the child control in the layout. The object is expected to have one or more from the attribute set top, bottom, left, right; each with a value of type sap.ui.core.CSSSize. If no object is given, the default is left=0px,right=0px

methods.description: Adds the given control and a corresponding position container into the aggregation named 'positions'. Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

methods.name: addPosition

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oPosition
parameters.description: The position to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some position to the aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}.

methods.name: destroyContent
methods.description: Destroys all aggregated position containers and their child controls. Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

methods.name: destroyPositions

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Destroys all the positions in the aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.zen.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Returns an array of the controls contained in the aggregated position containers (might be empty).

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}. The overall height of the control. When not set, 100% is automatically set. Default value is "100%".

methods.name: getHorizontalScrolling

returnValue.description: Value of property horizontalScrolling

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling}. 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode. Default value is Hidden.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.zen.commons.layout.AbsoluteLayout.

methods.name: getPositions
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}.

Positioned child controls within the layout

methods.name: getVerticalScrolling

returnValue.description: Value of property verticalScrolling

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling}. 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode. Default value is Hidden.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. The overall width of the control. When not set, 100% is automatically set. Default value is "100%".

methods.name: indexOfContent

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content of which the index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregated position containers, and returns the index of the container in the positions aggregation if found, or '-1' otherwise.

methods.name: indexOfPosition

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oPosition
parameters.description: The position whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer in the aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertContent

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The '0'-based index where the content shall be inserted at. For a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position '0'; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position.

parameters.name: oPos
parameters.description: JSON-like object which defines the position of the child control within the layout. The object is expected to have one or more from the attribute set top, bottom, left, right; each with a value of type sap.ui.core.CSSSize. If no object is given, the default is left=0px,right=0px.

methods.description: Inserts the given control and a corresponding position container into the aggregation named 'positions'. Returns 'this' to allow method chaining.

methods.name: insertPosition

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oPosition
parameters.description: The position to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the position should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the position is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the position is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a position into the aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}.

methods.name: removeAllContent
methods.description: Removes all aggregated position containers. Returns an array of the controls contained in the removed position containers (might be empty).

methods.name: removeAllPositions

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeContent

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content control to remove, its ID, or the index of the corresponding position container in the 'positions' aggregation.

methods.description: Removes the given control and its corresponding position container from the aggregation named 'positions'.

methods.name: removePosition

returnValue.description: The removed position or null

parameters.name: vPosition
parameters.description: The position to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a position from the aggregation {@link #getPositions positions}.

methods.name: setHeight

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sHeight
parameters.description: New value for property height

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. The overall height of the control. When not set, 100% is automatically set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "100%".

methods.name: setHorizontalScrolling

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sHorizontalScrolling
parameters.description: New value for property horizontalScrolling

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHorizontalScrolling horizontalScrolling}. 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Hidden.

methods.name: setPositionOfChild

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The child control for which to change the position information; if empty or not aggregated, nothing is changed

parameters.name: oPos
parameters.description: JSON-like object which defines the position of the child control. The object is expected to have one or more from the attribute set top, bottom, left, right; each with a value of type sap.ui.core.CSSSize. If no object is given, the default is used which is left=0px,right=0px.

methods.description: Allows to set or change the position information of the given child control

methods.name: setVerticalScrolling

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sVerticalScrolling
parameters.description: New value for property verticalScrolling

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getVerticalScrolling verticalScrolling}. 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Hidden.

methods.name: setWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sWidth
parameters.description: New value for property width

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. The overall width of the control. When not set, 100% is automatically set. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "100%".

properties.name: width
properties.description: CSS width of the matrix layout. If the LayoutFixed = true a adequate width should be provided.

properties.name: height
properties.description: CSS height of the matrix layout.

properties.name: layoutFixed
properties.description: Sets the table layout. If fixed the width parameter of a column has priority, if not the width of the content of the colums has priority. The default is "fixed". If the fixed layout is used a adequate width of the MatrixLayout should be provided. Otherwise the column width displayed could be different than the given ones because of browser dependend optimazations.

properties.name: columns
properties.description: Number of columns. If not specified, the number of columns will be determined from the given cells.

properties.name: widths
properties.description: Widths of the columns. Use an array to define the widths of the columns. If a column shall have an automatical sizing enter "auto" for this column width.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

methods.name: createRow

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining

parameters.name: rowContent
parameters.description: to add

methods.description:
Creates a new matrix layout row and appends it to this matrix layout.

Each argument must be either a matrix layout cell, which is added to the row "as is", or an arbitrary content control, which is wrapped with a new (default) matrix layout cell first and then added to the row.

methods.description: Destroys all the rows in the aggregation {@link #getRows rows}.

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell
symbols.description: Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutCell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: addStyleClass

parameters.name: sStyleClass
parameters.description: the CSS class name to be added

methods.description:
The string given as "sStyleClass" will be added to the "class" attribute of this element's root HTML element. This method is intended to be used to mark controls as being of a special type for which special styling can be provided using CSS selectors that reference this style class name. 
Example:
myButton.addStyleClass("myRedTextButton"); // add a CSS class to one button instance

...and in CSS:
.myRedTextButton {
color: red;
}
This will add the CSS class "myRedTextButton" to the Button HTML and the CSS code above will then make the text in this particular button red. Only characters allowed inside HTML attributes are allowed. Quotes are not allowed and this method will ignore any strings containing quotes. Strings containing spaces are interpreted as ONE custom style class (even though CSS selectors interpret them as different classes) and can only removed later by calling removeStyleClass() with exactly the same (space-containing) string as parameter. Multiple calls with the same sStyleClass will have no different effect than calling once. If sStyleClass is null, the call is ignored. Returns this to allow method chaining

methods.name: hasStyleClass

parameters.name: sStyleClass
parameters.description: the style to check for

methods.description: Returns true if the given style class string is valid and if this Element has this style class set via a previous call to addStyleClass().

methods.name: removeStyleClass

parameters.name: sStyleClass
parameters.description: the style to be removed

methods.description: Removes the given string from the list of custom style classes that have been set previously. Regular style classes like "sapUiBtn" cannot be removed. Returns this to allow method chaining

The string given as "sStyleClass" will be added to the "class" attribute of this element's root HTML element. This method is intended to be used to mark controls as being of a special type for which special styling can be provided using CSS selectors that reference this style class name. 
Example:
myButton.addStyleClass("myRedTextButton"); // add a CSS class to one button instance

...and in CSS:
.myRedTextButton {
color: red;
}
This will add the CSS class "myRedTextButton" to the Button HTML and the CSS code above will then make the text in this particular button red. Only characters allowed inside HTML attributes are allowed. Quotes are not allowed and this method will ignore any strings containing quotes. Strings containing spaces are interpreted as ONE custom style class (even though CSS selectors interpret them as different classes) and can only removed later by calling removeStyleClass() with exactly the same (space-containing) string as parameter. Multiple calls with the same sStyleClass will have no different effect than calling once. If sStyleClass is null, the call is ignored. Returns this to allow method chaining

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer
symbols.description: Is used to specify the position of a control in the AbsoluteLayout

properties.name: top
properties.description: Defines the distance to the top of the layout (as specified in HTML)

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: Defines the distance to the bottom of the layout (as specified in HTML)

properties.name: left
properties.description: Defines the distance to the left of the layout (as specified in HTML)

properties.name: right
properties.description: Defines the distance to the right of the layout (as specified in HTML)

properties.name: centerHorizontally
properties.description: Indicates whether this container shall be centered horizontally within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes left and right are ignored when this feature is activated.

properties.name: centerVertically
properties.description: Indicates whether this container should be centered vertically within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes top and bottom are ignored when this feature is activated.

aggregations.name: control
aggregations.description: Child control of the position container

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new layout/PositionContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.zen.commons.layout.PositionContainer with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.

methods.name: getCenterHorizontally

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCenterHorizontally centerHorizontally}. Indicates whether this container shall be centered horizontally within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes left and right are ignored when this feature is activated. Default value is false.

methods.name: getCenterVertically

returnValue.description: Value of property centerVertically

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCenterVertically centerVertically}. Indicates whether this container should be centered vertically within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes top and bottom are ignored when this feature is activated. Default value is false.

parameters.description: New value for property bottom

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBottom bottom}. Defines the distance to the bottom of the layout (as specified in HTML) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setCenterHorizontally

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bCenterHorizontally
parameters.description: New value for property centerHorizontally

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCenterHorizontally centerHorizontally}. Indicates whether this container shall be centered horizontally within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes left and right are ignored when this feature is activated. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setCenterVertically

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bCenterVertically
parameters.description: New value for property centerVertically

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCenterVertically centerVertically}. Indicates whether this container should be centered vertically within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes top and bottom are ignored when this feature is activated. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setControl

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control to set

methods.description: Sets the aggregated {@link #getControl control}.

methods.name: setLeft

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sLeft
parameters.description: New value for property left

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getLeft left}. Defines the distance to the left of the layout (as specified in HTML) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setRight

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sRight
parameters.description: New value for property right

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRight right}. Defines the distance to the right of the layout (as specified in HTML) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setTop

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTop
parameters.description: New value for property top

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTop top}. Defines the distance to the top of the layout (as specified in HTML) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: updatePosition

parameters.name: oPos
parameters.description: JSON-like object which defines the position of the child control in the absolute layout. The object is expected to have one or more out of the attributes top, bottom, left, right (each with a value of type sap.ui.core.CSSSize). If no object is given, nothing is updated.

methods.description: Updates the position properties of the container according to the given position in JSON style.

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.Padding
symbols.description: Padding, e.g. of a layout cell's content within the cell's borders. Note that all options except "None" include a padding of 2px at the top and bottom, and differ only in the presence of a 4px padding towards the beginning or end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

deprecated.text: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

properties.name: Begin
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its end.

properties.name: Both
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards both the beginning and end of a line.

properties.name: End
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its beginning.

properties.name: Neither
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. No padding towards neither the beginning nor end of a line.

properties.name: None
properties.description: No padding at all.

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.Separation
symbols.description: Separation, e.g. of a layout cell from its neighbor, via a vertical gutter of defined width, with or without a vertical line in its middle.

deprecated.text: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

properties.name: Large
properties.description: A large (63px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

properties.name: LargeWithLine
properties.description: A large (63px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

properties.name: Medium
properties.description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

properties.name: MediumWithLine
properties.description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

properties.name: None
properties.description: No gutter at all (0px), and without a vertical line, of course.

properties.name: Small
properties.description: A small (17px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

properties.name: SmallWithLine
properties.description: A small (17px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

symbols.name: sap.zen.commons.VAlign
symbols.description: Vertical alignment, e.g. of a layout cell's content within the cell's borders.

deprecated.text: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

properties.name: Bottom
properties.description: Aligned at the bottom.

properties.name: Middle
properties.description: Vertically centered.

properties.name: Top
properties.description: Aligned at the top.
